WorkItem.Description: I created a workbook with the local name "Department.name" in a sheet, referencing a single cell (B7). Then I accessed that cell in a formula (E11: formula "=Department.name"). Excel is evaluating ok, showing the value of cell B7 in cell E11. When I try to write the file with PHPExcel_Writer_Excel2007->save(), the parser reaches Calculation.php:2870 and throws the corresponding error.
WorkItem.Summary: Named ranges with dot don't get parsed properly

Comments.Message:
You're right... I'd though that defined names were limited to alphanumerics and underscores; but I've checked the MS Excel site, and a point is also valid (as long as it's not the first character). Named Range regexp updated accordingly.
Fixed in latest SVN code
